snippet: A federal judge took an important step toward ending secret donations to big-spending political groups.
abstract: Editorial praises decision by federal Judge Amy Berman Jackson that the Federal Election Commission must require advocacy groups to disclose the identities of all donors who give more than $1,000; holds that decision reverses 2007 policy at the FEC which opened a blatant loophole for wealthy and corporate donors to anonymously contribute to political campaigns; urges Congress to pass legislation that would enforce such transparency.
lead_paragraph: A federal judge took an important step toward ending secret donations to big-spending political groups.

headline.seo: A Judge Turns on the Light on Campaign Finance
